humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the tumor size is 5.5 x 4 x 4 cm. Based on the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby structures. In this report, the tumor size is given as 5.5 x 4 x 4 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is given to tumors that are larger than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
